entries.meaning: The sound of a muffled explosion.
examples: "Now you can see what life is like for us here," said Yakov Shoshani, raising his voice to make himself heard over the sound of a loud crump.

verbs.description: crump (third-person singular simple present crumps, present participle crumping, simple past and past participle crumped)
crump (third-person singular simple present crumps, present participle crumping, simple past and past participle crumped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, US, medical slang) (of one's health) to decline rapidly (but not as rapidly as crash).

adjectives.description: crump (comparative more crump, superlative most crump)

entries.meaning: (UK, Scotland, dialect) Hard or crusty; dry baked

description: From Middle English crump, cromp, croume, from Old English crump, crumb (“stooping, bent, crooked”), from Proto-West Germanic *krump, from Proto-Germanic *krumpaz, *krumbaz (“bent”).
Compare Dutch krom (“bent”), German krumm (“crooked”), Danish krum. Related to cramp.

adjectives.description: crump (comparative more crump, superlative most crump)
